name: Salt & Pepper Tofu (椒鹽豆腐)
description: Fragrant deep-fried tofu that'll disappear from the table before you know it!

recipeInstructions.name: Cut ingredients
recipeInstructions.text: First, cut to separate the green and the white parts of the green onions. You're only using the firmer, more pungent whites for this dish. Dice the green onion whites.

recipeInstructions.name: Cut tofu
recipeInstructions.text: Drain and rinse the firm tofu. Cut the tofu into cubes.

recipeInstructions.name: Boil tofu
recipeInstructions.text: Boil hot water in a pot with the heat on high. Add salt and stir to dissolve. When water is boiling, add the tofu cubes. Use chopsticks to shift the tofu around so they’re all fully submerged.

recipeInstructions.name: Dry & coat tofu
recipeInstructions.text: Line a plate with a paper towel or a clean kitchen towel. Transfer the tofu cubes onto the lined plate in an even layer. Lay another towel on top and gently press to remove excess moisture.

recipeInstructions.name: Fry tofu
recipeInstructions.text: Add oil to a large pot and set the heat on high.

recipeInstructions.name: Stir-fry everything
recipeInstructions.text: Heat a wok on high. Add oil (take this from the deep-frying oil). Before the oil gets too hot (before it starts to shimmer or smoke), add the dried chili and stir immediately. Fry for just 8 seconds to extract the flavor, and then remove them.

recipeInstructions.name: Plate & serve
recipeInstructions.text: Turn off the heat and plate. Make sure to scoop up all the little bits of vegetables; they're delicious. Enjoy!
